original_title: CSE picks-up speed following CBSL interest rate decision and growth predictions
original_body_lines: CSE trading activities took off at a slow pace yesterday but later turned positive following the Central Bank’s decision to keep policy rates unchanged at 7.75 percent and projections that the decision will help in steering inflation towards the target of 5 percent coupled with an expansion of economic growth, market analysts said.

Amid those developments both indices moved upwards. The All Share Price Index went up by 55.6 points while S and P SL20 rose by 14.08 points. Turnover stood at Rs 5.57 billion with 12 crossings. The top seven crossings were: VallibelOne 3.6 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 372 million and its shares traded at Rs 103, Jetwing Symphony 13 million shares crossed for Rs 227 million; its shares traded at Rs 18.10, Hayleys 700,000 shares crossed for Rs 130 million; its shares traded at Rs 188.

Ceylinco Holdings 30000 shares crossed to the tune of Rs 95.2 million; its shares traded at Rs 3175, DFCC 500,000 shares crossed for Rs 81.4 million; its shares traded at Rs 162.75, Commercial Bank 392,000 shares crossed to the tune of Rs 76 million; its shares traded at Rs 194 and HNB (Non- Voting) 150,000 shares crossed for Rs 44.8 million; its shares traded at Rs 299.

In the retail market companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; Browns Investments Rs 307 million (37.8 million shares traded), LB Finance Rs 219 million (1.5 million shares traded), JKH Rs 212 million (9.4 million shares traded), NTB Rs 211 million (669,000 shares traded), Vallibel One Rs 186 million (1.8 million shares traded), PickMe Rs 166 million (1.2 million shares traded) and Sierra Cables Rs 160 million (5.7 million shares traded). During the day 185.8 million share volumes changed hands in 31214 transactions.
It is said that investment sector counters, especially Browns Investments, were active at the floor while the financial and banking sector also contributed to the turnover significantly.

Mercantile Investments and Finance said it will seek shareholder approval for a share sub-division which will see an ordinary share split into 200 ordinary shares. 3,006,000 ordinary shares of the company are to be split, CSE sources said. There will be 601,200,000 ordinary shares after the subdivision. The subdivision of shares will not result in any change to the stated capital of the company, Mercantile Investments and Finance said.
Yesterday the rupee opened slightly weaker at Rs 302.55/60 to the US dollar, from Rs 302.45/60 the previous day, while bond yields were broadly steady, dealers said.

A bond maturing on 15.12.2026 was quoted at 8.25/35 percent, down from 8.28/33 percent. A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted flat at 8.65/75 percent. A bond maturing on 15.12.2028 was quoted at 9.00/9.05 percent, down from 9.05/15 percent. A bond maturing on 01.07.2030 was quoted at 9.70/75 percent, up from 9.68/75 percent. A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.40/50 percent, up from 10.42/48 percent.

An auction of Rs. 38,000 million Treasury bills was ongoing. The telegraphic transfer rates for the American dollar was 299.0000 buying, 306.0000 selling; the British pound was 403.0983 buying and 414.4601 selling, and the euro was 350.6526 buying, 362.0158 selling.
